quote:
'You know, all the problems in my life, just a story I've created.'
 'Hm, yeah.'

The most important part is you take action and start doing whatever is in front of you.
 I take a step forward, and stuff starts running at me.
source: Unemployed to Jr. Software Developer at 45 (YouTube)

quote: Natural stresses shape people into functioning human beings; man-made stresses served to weaken a man and make him ill. One resembles strength; the other resembles weakness.
As you start to walk on the way, the way appears.
It takes only 6 months of pure dedication to change your life.

The best way to grow without pressure is to grow in solitude.
 Away from the eyes of everyone and at your own pace.
Perfect is the enemy of good.
discipline
Speech is of Time, Silence is of Eternity.
Rise but seldom—let this be on important matters—and then make yourself thoroughly acquainted with the subject.
Never be agitated by more than a decent warmth, & offer your sentiments with modest diffidence.
Prayers, progress, patience.
Procrastination is really a self-inflicted wound that gradually chips away at the most valuable resource in the world: time.
The best personal remedy for procrastination might actually be self-forgiveness.
Of course it's the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
Adopt the pace of nature; her secret is patience.
The spirit of envy can destroy; it can never build.
Don't be too eager to deal out death and judgment. Even the very wise cannot see all ends.
To be an aristocrat, one must be the unselfish devotee of excellence.
In the midst of all this chaos, the aristocratic spirit stands serene, and in a very deep sense, untroubled.
